title: Axioms of Existence for the Adinkra-Stabilized Hypercube Model (ASH Model)
description: Five foundational axioms defining existence within a multi-realm cosmological framework, formalized using relational ontology, information theory, and Kripke-frame semantics. These axioms underpin persistence, consciousness, and structural conservation in the 9D hypercube.

axioms.name: Relational_Existence
axioms.summary: An entity exists in a world only if it participates in at least one relation with another entity.
axioms.formal: Given a world W = (X, R), x ∈ X exists in W iff ∃ y ∈ X such that (x, y) ∈ R or (y, x) ∈ R.
story_implications: No truly isolated being; even in hell or void, some relation holds (to Lucifer, to a plane, to a law).
A character entirely cut off from all relations effectively ceases to exist in that world.

axioms.name: Structural_Compressibility
axioms.summary: An entity is a real pattern if its description can be compressed into a shorter rule set than its raw data.
axioms.formal: For encoding E(x) and Kolmogorov complexity K(x), an entity exists as a distinct pattern if K(x) << |E(x)|.
story_implications: Souls are patterned and repeatable across lifetimes.
Pure random chaos has no persistent self.
Mythic beings (wolves, angels, gods) arise from simple deep rules generating complex appearances.

axioms.name: Multi_Scale_Persistence
axioms.summary: A real entity persists as a recognizable pattern across time and scale.
axioms.formal: For coarse-graining operators G_s, x exists robustly if d(G_s(x), G_s'(x)) ≤ ε for s, s' in some interval.
story_implications: Angel and mortal aspects of the same being are scale versions of one pattern.
Losing persistence across scales is a step toward oblivion.

axioms.name: Energetic_Cost_of_Erasure
axioms.summary: Erasing a structured pattern requires non-zero energy; structure that costs nothing to erase is not physically instantiated.
axioms.formal: By Landauer's principle, E_erase ≥ k_B T ln 2 * H(x), so H(x) > 0 implies nonzero erasure cost.
story_implications: Destroying a soul or plane is enormously costly or almost impossible.
Lucifer and the Creator act as guardians of conservation of structure.
Hell and Shadow act as containment to prevent cheap annihilation into oblivion.

axioms.name: Self_Reference_for_Consciousness
axioms.summary: A system is conscious if it contains a substructure that models itself and updates that model in response to its own state.
axioms.formal: For system S with state space Σ and subsystem M ⊂ Σ, S is conscious iff there exists decoding π such that π(M(t)) ≈ S(t) and M(t+1) = f(M(t), S(t)).
story_implications: The narrator and Kaelen are conscious because they have internal models (higher self, wolves).
Angels and advanced beings carry more accurate self-models.
Entities with no self-model may exist but lack true subjectivity.
